lines.content: Espresso is a lightweight command-line task manager for tracking todos, deadlines, and events. It’s fast, minimal, and designed for users who prefer typing to clicking. All tasks are saved automatically to disk.
1. Ensure you have **Java 17 or above** installed.
3. Place it in your desired working directory.
4. Open a terminal, and navigate to that directory with `cd` and run:
5. Type commands directly into the console and press Enter to execute.
* Mark and unmark tasks as done
* Automatic persistent storage on every change
* Input parsing and validation with user-friendly messages
* Words in `UPPER_CASE` are parameters to be supplied by the user.\
* Parameters are **positional** and must follow the expected order.
* Extraneous parameters for commands that don’t accept them (e.g. `list`, `bye`) will be ignored.
Displays a message explaining how to access help.
Adds a simple task with no time constraints.
Adds a task with a due date or time.
Adds a task with a start and end time.
Displays all tasks with their status and type.
Marks the specified task as completed.
Marks the specified task as not completed.
Removes the specified task from the list.
Searches for tasks whose descriptions contain any of the given keywords.
Saves all tasks and exits the application.
All tasks are saved automatically to disk after any change. No manual saving is required.
Tasks are stored in a plain text file. Each line represents a task in the format:
* `METADATA` includes task-specific data like deadlines or event times
Advanced users may edit this file directly, but malformed edits may cause tasks to be skipped on load. Always back up the file before manual changes.
**Q:** How do I transfer my tasks to another computer?\
**A:** Copy the task file from your current working directory to the same location on the new machine before launching the app.
* Invalid or malformed lines in the data file will be skipped during startup.
* Manual edits to the data file can produce unexpected behavior if formatting rules are not followed.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Espresso.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Espresso.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Espresso is a lightweight command-line task manager for tracking todos, deadlines, and events. It’s fast, minimal, and designed for users who prefer typing to clicking. All tasks are saved automatically to disk.
1. Ensure you have **Java 17 or above** installed.
3. Place it in your desired working directory.
4. Open a terminal, and navigate to that directory with `cd` and run:
5. Type commands directly into the console and press Enter to execute.
* Mark and unmark tasks as done
* Automatic persistent storage on every change
* Input parsing and validation with user-friendly messages
* Words in `UPPER_CASE` are parameters to be supplied by the user.\
* Parameters are **positional** and must follow the expected order.
* Extraneous parameters for commands that don’t accept them (e.g. `list`, `bye`) will be ignored.
Displays a message explaining how to access help.
Adds a simple task with no time constraints.
Adds a task with a due date or time.
Adds a task with a start and end time.
Displays all tasks with their status and type.
Marks the specified task as completed.
Marks the specified task as not completed.
Removes the specified task from the list.
Searches for tasks whose descriptions contain any of the given keywords.
Saves all tasks and exits the application.
All tasks are saved automatically to disk after any change. No manual saving is required.
Tasks are stored in a plain text file. Each line represents a task in the format:
* `METADATA` includes task-specific data like deadlines or event times
Advanced users may edit this file directly, but malformed edits may cause tasks to be skipped on load. Always back up the file before manual changes.
**Q:** How do I transfer my tasks to another computer?\
**A:** Copy the task file from your current working directory to the same location on the new machine before launching the app.

* Manual edits to the data file can produce unexpected behavior if formatting rules are not followed.
* Entry point for the Espresso application.
* Initializes task data, launches the main command loop, and handles graceful shutdown.
* Initializes the application by loading tasks from file
* Main method that starts the Espresso application.
* Invokes initialization, enters the command loop, and prints exit message.
* The {@code ActionManager} class handles the main interaction loop and delegates
* user commands to the appropriate task management actions.
* Starts the main input loop for the application.
* Continuously reads user input from the console until the user types "bye".
* Each input is parsed and executed as a command.
* Parses and executes a user command.
* Delegates the command to the appropriate method in {@link TaskManager}.
* @param userInput the raw input string entered by the user
* Represents a parsed command from user input.
* Stores the command type, description, and any additional arguments
* such as task index, deadline, event timing, or keywords.
* Constructs a {@code Command} with the specified type and description.
* @param description the raw description or arguments from user input
* Returns the type of this command.
* Returns the description or arguments associated with this command.
* Returns the task index associated with this command.
* @return the task index, or -1 if not set
* Sets the task index for this command.
* @param index the index of the task
* Returns the deadline string associated with this command.
* Sets the deadline string for this command.
* Returns the start time of an event associated with this command.
* Sets the start time of an event for this command.
* Returns the end time of an event associated with this command.
* Sets the end time of an event for this command.
* Returns the array of keywords used in a FIND command.
* Sets the keywords for a FIND command.
* Checks if this command is of type {@code INVALID}.
* @return {@code true} if the command type is INVALID, {@code false} otherwise
* Represents the types of commands that can be parsed and executed by the application.
* Each enum value corresponds to a specific user action or command.

* Utility class for writing task data to a file.

* @throws IOException if the file cannot be accessed or written
public static boolean writeToFile(String filePath, String content, boolean append) throws IOException {

public static boolean writeToFileAgain(String filePath, String content, boolean append) {

* Represents a parsed line from the task data file.
* Encapsulates task type, completion status, description, and any additional metadata.
* Includes validation logic to ensure structural integrity of parsed input.
* Constructs a {@code ParsedLine} object by validating and extracting components.
* @param taskType    the type of task ("T", "D", or "E")
* @param marked      the completion status ("1" for done, "0" for not done)
* @param remainder   additional metadata (e.g., deadline or event timing)
public ParsedLine(String taskType, String marked, String description, String remainder) {
* Checks whether all components of the parsed line are valid.
* @return {@code true} if task type, marked status, and description are valid
/** @return {@code true} if the task is marked as completed */
/** @return array of additional metadata (e.g., deadline or event timing) */
/** @param isValidTaskType sets the validity flag for task type */
/** @param isValidMarked sets the validity flag for marked status */
/** @param isValidDescription sets the validity flag for description */
* @param taskType the task type code to validate
* @param marked the marked status to validate
* Centralized repository of error messages used for input validation.
* These constants are referenced by {@link Parser} and {@link Validator}
* to provide consistent feedback when user commands are malformed or incomplete.
/** Triggered when the /from parameter exists but has no content. */
"Your /from parameter is empty. Please add something behind the parameter /from";
/** Triggered when the /from parameter is missing entirely. */
"Your /from parameter is missing. Please add the parameter /from";
/** Triggered when the /to parameter exists but has no content. */
"Your /to parameter is empty. Please add something behind the parameter /to";
/** Triggered when the /to parameter is missing entirely. */
"Your /to parameter is missing. Please add the parameter /to";
/** Triggered when the event name is missing before the /from parameter. */
"Your event is missing a name. Please ensure there is something before /from";
/** Triggered when /from appears after /to, violating expected order. */
"Your event command is in the wrong order. Please ensure the /from is before the /to";
/** Triggered when a todo command lacks a task name. */
"Your todo is missing a name. Please ensure there is something after todo";
/** Triggered when the /by parameter exists but has no content. */
"Your deadline is missing a due date/time. Please ensure there is something after the /by";
/** Triggered when the /by parameter is missing entirely. */
"Your /by parameter is missing. Please add the parameter /by";
/** Triggered when the deadline name is missing before the /by parameter. */
"Your deadline is missing a name. Please ensure there is something after deadline but before /by";
/** Triggered when the task index is not a valid integer. */
"Your task index is not a valid number. Please enter an integer";
/** Triggered when the task index is missing from the command. */
"Your task index is missing. Please enter an integer";
/** Triggered when the command keyword is unrecognized or unsupported. */
/** Triggered when the find command is missing a keyword to search for. */
"Your task description is missing. Please add something after the word 'find'";
* Parses user input strings into structured {@code Command} objects.
* Supports task creation, modification, deletion, and search operations.
* Parses raw user input into a {@code Command} object.
* Determines the command type based on the first keyword and delegates to specialized parsers.
* @param userInput the full input string entered by the user
* @return a {@code Command} object representing the parsed action
* Parses a todo command and validates its structure.
* @param remainder the portion of input after the "todo" keyword
* @return a valid {@code Command} or an invalid one with error message
* Parses commands that operate on a task index (e.g., mark, unmark, delete).
* Validates the index and sets it in the command.
* @param type      the command type (MARK, UNMARK, DELETE)
* @param remainder the portion of input containing the index
* @return a valid {@code Command} with task index, or an invalid one with error message
private static Command parseIndexCommand(CommandType type, String remainder) {
* Parses a deadline command and extracts description and due date.
* Validates the presence and position of the "/by" parameter.
* @param remainder the portion of input after the "deadline" keyword
* @return a valid {@code Command} with deadline info, or an invalid one with error message
* Parses an event command and extracts description, start time, and end time.
* Validates the presence and order of "/from" and "/to" parameters.
* @param remainder the portion of input after the "event" keyword
* @return a valid {@code Command} with event timing, or an invalid one with error message
* Parses a find command and extracts search keywords.
* Validates that at least one keyword is present.
* @param remainder the portion of input after the "find" keyword
* @return a valid {@code Command} with keywords, or an invalid one with error message
* Provides validation logic for user input commands.
* Ensures structural correctness and semantic integrity before command execution.
* Validates commands that require a task index (e.g., mark, unmark, delete).
* Checks for presence and numeric validity of the index.
* @param command   the type of command being validated
* @param remainder the input string expected to contain the index
* @return a {@code Command} marked VALID if the index is present and numeric;
*         otherwise INVALID with an appropriate error message
public static Command validateIndex(CommandType command, String remainder) {
* Validates a todo command to ensure it includes a non-empty task name.
* @param remainder the input string expected to contain the task name
* @return a {@code Command} marked VALID if the name is present;
*         otherwise INVALID with an appropriate error message
* Validates an event command by checking the presence and order of "/from" and "/to" parameters.
* Also ensures that the event name and time ranges are non-empty and correctly positioned.
* @param fromIndex index of the "/from" parameter in the input string
* @param toIndex   index of the "/to" parameter in the input string
* @param remainder the full input string after the "event" keyword
* @return a {@code Command} marked VALID if all components are structurally correct;
*         otherwise INVALID with a specific error message
public static Command validateEventIndexes(int fromIndex, int toIndex, String remainder) {
* Validates a deadline command by checking the presence and position of the "/by" parameter.
* Ensures that both the task name and due date are present and correctly formatted.
* @param byIndex   index of the "/by" parameter in the input string
* @param remainder the full input string after the "deadline" keyword
* @return a {@code Command} marked VALID if all components are structurally correct;
*         otherwise INVALID with a specific error message
public static Command validateDeadlineIndexes(int byIndex, String remainder) {
